headline.0: Israelis and Palestinians at Harvard: Part 9 of 9
headline.1: Israel's Bedouin Schools Thrive in Negev Desert

short_description.0: My time with future leaders of Israel and Palestine leaves me with a somewhat pessimistic outlook, but there is reason for hope.
short_description.1: In the sandy dunes of the northern Negev desert between Arad and Be'er Sheva, 130 students who belong to a local Bedouin tribe, study at the Al-Sayed Technological School. The students come from a weak socio-economic background and a great number of students suffer from learning disabilities as a result of inter-family marriages.

authors.1: Anav Silverman, ContributorInternational Correspondent in Jerusalem
